Reviews.Title: “Great value this time”
Reviews.Author: Interested01
Reviews.Content: Convenient location for driving to awesome Del Mar beaches, hiking in Torrey Pines Reserve, Jimbo's Naturally (my favorite food store--fresh vegetable juices, etc.), La Jolla, Pacific Beach, north county locations. Very low price for advance purchase this time. Expect much higher rates during the Del Mar racing season, which runs July 18 - September 5 this year. I had a bad stay here a few years ago but since then I've found the front desk people friendly and helpful and the rooms better. Clean room, wireless service works well. No complaints. Hampton Inn breakfasts can be okay, but go early if you can (to avoid dried out scrambled eggs and poor pastry selection).

Reviews.Title: “an average hampton”
Reviews.Author: rmc76
Reviews.Content: An average Hampton Inn off the highway in an office park. A short drive to the beach or restaurants. Quiet, comfortable room. Had problems getting wi-fi on fourth floor.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Guicole
Reviews.Content: Overall à great stay, Nice people really clean, great bed... I'll definitly come back! I stayed twice, about 13 days total.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, well-run, friendly, clean”
Reviews.Author: CurtEastPoint
Reviews.Content: What more do you need? The staff is TOP NOTCH! Reception is knowledgeable, friendly, willing to shuttle me around locally. Breakfast kinda typical Hamptom but plentiful and good. VERY CLEAN hotel. I can't say enough good things about it. I cannot imagine what the other 'roadwarrior' reviewer was going on about.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst Hampton Inns”
Reviews.Author: 20RoadWarrior55
Reviews.Content: Talk about tiny beds, dingy outdated rooms, WAY TOO SMALL. The beds were full size not queens and they were the most uncomfortable ones. I stay at Hampton Inns and know their quality, quite frankly this dump needs a bulldozer. This pathetic place does not even come close to a red roof inn or a motel 6. STEER CLEAR. I had to make a last minute reservation and all of the nice hotel around the area were booked except this dump. You wonder why and now I know, rather sleep on a park bench on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with short drive to the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: AZMN2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days in Sept 2011. For the most part we liked the clean facility and we were not inconvenienced by the distance from San Diego. We purposely picked it since it was a little ways out but not too far. We really liked being just a short drive from the ocean but not having to pay for ocean front rentals. A massive Southern California power outage happened while we stayed there and there was no power available but that was not the hotels fault. Communication could have been better from the staff as far as how to handle things with no power but nothing bad happened. We inquired about food safety in the restaurant due to the freezers/fridges having no power and they assured us not to worry and precautions had been taken.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: lindylove
Reviews.Content: Dissapointing there are no cookies on the weekend after I was told to come back around 7pm because they were not available yet, only to find they don't even serve them on those days. No hot water for coco, and was not a priority even after I requested some. Room was clean and convenient next to stairs, but the carpet seemed dirty. Parking is atrocious. Pool is cold and no hot tub/spa. Check out time was flexible which made it worth my time. Overall I think it is priced a little high since it is quite a distance from downtown and sites. The breakfast was nothing special but better than continental; premade stuff heated up. I heard kids next door and baby crying which is not the hotel's fault.

Reviews.Title: “Good for short stay”
Reviews.Author: rbrown5305
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days while doing some shopping in San Diego area. Hotel was clean, quiet and safe. The breakfast was very good and well prepared. The exit from the Interstate was a bit confusing but overall good place. Parking is located underground but the elevator is available and takes you from there to your floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a one night stay”
Reviews.Author: bluefaery
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night last week for work and it was a nice comfortable stay. The room was clean and the staff was friendly when I checked in. My bed was comfortable and the room was quiet. They had the typical Hampton Inn breakfast which is decent. It is conveniently located to the freeway as well. I would have no problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: got-rice
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough...the breakfast was good. Delivers as promised.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a night- Comfortable Bed, Great Free Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: BiotechCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Stopped on the way to San Diego for a night. Easy, friendly and affordable. Only complaint is a small tv. Bed was really comfortable, free breakfast is always a nice perk as are the fresh baked cookies available at the front desk. Parking could be an issue if crowded....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfuly stay for family trip to Sea World and the Zoo”
Reviews.Author: ibkatg
Reviews.Content: We weren't so sure about this hotel when we booked it because it was so cheap for everything they were offering especially when compared to other hotels nearby but we were most certainly pleasantly surprised when we arrived. Friendly staff, clean good sized room, great continental breakfast with lots of healthy and not so healthy options :-) Parking was wonderful and FREE! More than I could have asked for for the price. Would definitely stay again. If I had to offer any criticism it would be that the carpets looked pretty worn and maybe could use a shampoo, but other than that place was great.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised by reviews”
Reviews.Author: liveinasuitcase
Reviews.Content: I have stayed her over the years as one of my favorite spots because of proximity to the beach. I almost didnâ€™t stay this time because because of some reviews and am glad I didnâ€™t listen. You can see from my reviews that clean is of utmost importance to me. Last time I stayed they had been updating the rooms. The suite they gave me this time I had stayed in before and it was updated from then. My white socks were still clean from the carpet. Since the carpet is kind of old thatâ€™s remarkable. Even the white grout in the bathroom was clean and it was the same floor. Not a water spot in the bathroom or a speck in a drawer even. No dust. Even the bed skirt and shower curtain was clean. This room was as clean, clean, clean as a hotel room gets. It looked new. I even enjoyed snuggling into the bed. If all rooms were this clean, Iâ€™d still enjoy traveling. They are always cleaning something at this hotel. Rooms, hallways, lobbies, parking lots, garage. I have no idea what the bad reviews are for.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: sobaytravelguy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in nearby hotels (Marriott and Doubletree) on past rips to the area, but decided to try the Hampton Inn. Am I glad I did! The rooms might be a bit smaller, but they are attractive, with good bedding and flat screen TVs. Mine was very quiet. The hotel has a decent fitness room, an outdoor pool, free buffet breakfast, free parking and free internet. Compared to the neighboring hots, those freebees saved me $$$. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied but One Big Issue”
Reviews.Author: ElectricMayhem
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hampton Inn Del Mar for one night. The hotel is a very good value for the price. The rooms are large and clean. Free wifi and flatscreen TV. Safe underground parking area. A small pool in front and a good complimentary breakfast. Located just off the highway and convenient to Del Mar. Probably a 20-25 min drive from downtown San Diego. Our one issue was that we booked online well for two nights well in advance. About a month before our stay, we had to cancel the first night. We were told that we could not have a refund or credit for the first night, whcih which was frustrating. Then, we requested an early check in and they said it might not be available. But we were paying for the previous night anyways? Why can't we have an early check in to a room we had already paid for? After some wrangling, it was agreed that the staff would check us in as if we had stayed for both nights. Things went smoothly once we arrived, but the whole situation left a bitter taste in our mouths.

Reviews.Title: “Not to Hampton Standardsâ€¦.”
Reviews.Author: sleepycapt
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent Hampton Inn guest, and this one was something of a disappointment. Not the quality I had become accustomed to. Rates were as good as I could find in this area, plus there is free parking available. The location is a bit odd-- there four hotels at this corner, but you will definitely need a car. This property is old and dingy, and has not been properly renovated. Lobby and breakfast area are a bit dated and cheap. There is a pool in the middle of a parking lot and a small fitness area. There is one small workstation and free wi-fi in the rooms. Breakfast was the usual Hampton stuff--- lousy even for free. Desk staff was reasonable helpful. Now for the rooms. They are very plain for a Hampton. Definitely the sparest Iâ€™ve seen. The furniture is cheap and sparse, dÃ©cor is extremely plain. Over the tiny window, you can either open the drapes completely or sit in darkness. There is no view to speak of from any rooms. There is no fridge. Most annoying of all, there is a very distinct odor in both the rooms and the halls. Carpets are absolutely filthy-- your feet will literally STICK to the floor (yes, stick). And then I saw the reasonâ€”in order to fight the musty odor, housekeeping staff have been asked to spray Febreze in every room every time. Attention management: this stuff does not go away, becomes stickier and stickier on the carpet, the rooms smell more, then need more deodorizing, etc. You need to TEAR IT OUT, not spray slime on it. There is nothing to see at this exact location, nor anywhere to eat, though you can easily get downtown or to the beaches in fifteen minutes. Freeway is two minutes from the door. To get my rate, I had to pay in advanceâ€”that was a mistake, as I could not depart early under this non-refundable rate. Rates are reasonable compared to other properties, but letâ€™s be clearâ€”this is more of a fair $70 a nite motel than a Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Soccer tournament”
Reviews.Author: coastalbrett
Reviews.Content: Limited service hotels are what they are. This one is no different. Small but comfortable room and of course no restaurant on site. Funky little pool but again, adequate. Location is great and close to other amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great service everytime I Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beth9261
Reviews.Content: I have been working in San Diego, for the last 3 months and in the beginning was provided with the DoubleTree in Delmar and the Hampton Inn Delmar as hotels that were sponsored by the client. The DoubleTree was full, so I booked the Hampton Inn, and have been staying there since, not because the DoubleTree was full, but because I have had such great service from Maggie Curella and the rest of the staff. Since I basically live in a hotel Monday through Thursday, it becomes my home away from home and they have gone above and beyond to make sure I have a refrigerator and now a microwave to use so that I don't have to eat out all the time! I also had a 2 week period where I needed to stay over the weekend, but there was one night where a room was not available, which meant that I would have to leave the hotel. I sent a note to Maggie, and she worked her magic and found a room available, so I never had to check out the entire time! I will continue to book at the Hampton Inn as long as I am working in San Diego. They have earned my appreciation and my business.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable - but hard to find!”
Reviews.Author: PeteM01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days at the end of our family US road trip. My wife had previously worked in La Jolla and so we wanted to stay here rather than San Diego proper. We wanted something with a reasonable degree of comfort and a reasonable price - not easy to do around San Diego in the summer! On the whole, we really liked it. There were plenty of kids around because of a synchro swimming competition in town, so the place was quite lively but it did not seem noisy or too busy. The rooms were a decent size, with good firm beds and a bath. We were allowed to check-in early by the gracious lady at the front-desk, and walked to the Valley Centre (0.5 miles) for lunch. We had an OK buffet curry but there were several other options. The pool and the gym were quiet that Friday afternoon, and were small but acceptable. On our final night, we ate at the nearby Mexican which was again quite decent. The breakfast in the hotel was not bad, with hot options as well as the usual array of pastries and fruit. Good coffee was available throughout the day in the breakfast room, in which we could always find a family-sized table to eat at. This room also contained the only computer with printer for boarding card printing etc. We had two minor problems with the Inn: the first was the lack of a warning on the TV games console about the price - my kids thought it was free but we were charged $7 an hour for this. There is some small print on the opening screen but nothing that kids would notice, so be warned about this if your kids have a separate room. The other problem was locating the entrances to the Inn - several times we shot past and had to detour a bit to find a place to U-turn. Ok, so this was my incompetence as a navigator but a couple of signs would have been nice, as the place is set-back behind a gas-station and a Taco Bell. Both Del Mar and the La Jolla Reserve are a couple of minutes drive (or even walk) away, so the location was perfect for us. Getting to the airport on Monday morning was also surprisingly easy, even at 8am. The Freeway was not too busy, considering the time and so the journey took less than 30 minutes. We would stay here again if we travelled to La Jolla again.

Reviews.Title: “OK, with many caveats”
Reviews.Author: glancetrip
Reviews.Content: Pros: Although close to a freeway and behind a gas station, quiet rooms. Well located, close to restaurants and to the beach. Acceptable price for the location. Cons: Musky odor. Bad and unresponsive reception. Scant breakfast. Buffet not replenished. Smelly rooms with dirty carpet floors. Worse of all. I got several bed bug bites and had to use cortisone creams for a week to heal them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value, wonderful breakfast, comfortable beds!”
Reviews.Author: alsobidingmytime
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because I could stay for free for 3 nights using Hilton Honors points. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean -- 2 of my requirements. The breakfast was quite the bonus -- both hot and cold foods and quite a variety with make your own waffles, eggs, potatoes, sausage plus cereals, oatmeal, pastries, fruit, yogurt. Definitely well stocked and choices for everyone. I was also pleasantly surprised to find out the hotel is dog-friendly. Next time, I will bring my dog. Parking was great -- in the underground secured garage or street level and it was free. Very few southern CA hotels have free parking. The hotel allowed my traveling companion to do a late checkout with no hassle.

Reviews.Title: “CA vacation”
Reviews.Author: AZtravelingkids
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last Oct with our two kids - and we just booked a return trip to this hotel again for this fall. Hotel is very well-located - easy to get to beaches, down to museums in San Diego and up I-5 to LegoLand! The hotel was very kid-friendly - great breakfast and our room had enough space for kids to create a "play area" on the floor with their matchbox cars!

Reviews.Title: “Not your standard Hampton inn”
Reviews.Author: vcnk
Reviews.Content: Room - very sticky floors, AC turned off on its own & never came back on Breakfast - subpar, few selection, items not refilled, very small for a Hampton Inn breakfast, workers overwhelmed by amount of people HH awards member - not acknowledged Front desk - professional but unresponsive when told that another guest (not in our party) needed assistance Location - next to freeway, nice area Hallways - muggy smell (as another review mentioned), warm, perhaps the AC went out in the hallways too Elevator - shared with housekeeping who don't try to make room for you to share the space. She just looked at us (with food in our hands) and waited for the door to close (and left without us.)

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was ok - staff members were terrific!”
Reviews.Author: echolaine
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Josh and Amanda and another nice guy at the front desk, my review is upgraded from 3 to a 4. This is an older property - you can tell by the paucity of electric outlets. Not much charging space next to the bed, and the room had an odd odor which cleared out (or I got used to it) after turning on the air conditioner. It was quiet, wifi worked well even in a room at the very end of a hall, and I liked the underground parking - very convenient in a rainstorm. About half a mile away is a shopping center with a grocery store, excellent sushi restaurant, and other places to eat. Tio Pepes, a Mexican restaurant, is within walking distance, although I did not eat there. I attended a conference at the Doubletree and stayed at the Hampton for about $50 less per night and had free breakfast and free wifi; both of which the Doubletree charges for. It was a 5 minute walk over and back each day, which I enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Have tried all nearby hotels but Hampton Inn is the Gold Standard”
Reviews.Author: lovecoronado
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler to Del Mar, CA. Had stayed in all the nearby hotels and decided to try Hampton Inn. The room was spacious and immaculate. All staff team members were courteous and professional. The free parking (I pay $17-$35 per day at comparable hotels) was close-up outside or in a gated underground garage. In minutes I logged on to my lap top. Free, unlimited high-speed wireless internet. The free buffet breakfast was beyond compare--eggs, waffles, cereals, fresh fruit, three blends of coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fruit juices, bagels, muffins, fresh fruit, pastry and much more. If you plan to visit the San Diego/Del Mar area don't even consider another hotel. Add the excellent service, clean room, friendly pleasant ambiance, free parking, free internet, bountiful free breakfast and peace of mind-- then factor your room rate. I have spinal stenosis and five degenerative lower lumbar discs. For 19 years (and as many mattresses) I wake up with severe back pain. Because I travel often I dread hotel beds. For three days I woke up pain-free! Trust me, they just don't get any better than the Hampton Inn, San Diego/Del Mar California.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Smart_India_traveler
Reviews.Content: Value for money even if you are looking for a weekend get-away. Near by market area has a lot of restaurants as well. Only thing missing is room service...

Reviews.Title: “Good times, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: rickstil
Reviews.Content: Good location no views whatsoever but the staff we incredible. I was particularity impressed with Josh at the front desk. We needed a tad more space since we were traveling with my young daughter and he went out of his way to accommodate. The Breakfasts each morning were wonderful with friendly attentive staff.

Reviews.Title: “Average for a Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerjpn
Reviews.Content: Hampton Inn boasts a stellar, overall reputation from personal and professional experience so this was a natural choice for a stay in North County San Diego. However, this Del Mar location was merely average, not a notch above the rest. PROS: Given the close proximity to I-5, the room was surprisingly quiet with double-paned windows - absolutely no noise. It's very close to Sorrento Valley, La Jolla, and a quick hop to Downtown San Diego so the commute is little to none. Surrounding amenities are excellent: Von's grocery store, multiple restaurants (Mexican, Thai, American Contemporary, Sushi, BBQ, and fast food) and gas stations. It is seven (7) minutes to Torrey Pines State Reserve and Beach which is an excellent option for fitness enthusiasts and those just looking to soak up the North County San Diego Beach scene for even just a short while. The breakfast spread was excellent with even more healthy options to boot: oatmeal, skim milk, cereal, and very fresh fruit (apples and bananas). The breakfast area was spacious, clean, and well attended to. They have made a conscientious effort in the area of security. The front is locked down after 10 pm and the underground parking provides vehicle peace of mind. Small steps, but preventative ones. CONS: Scrambled eggs were from a camping package. There is no reason to provide scrambled eggs unless they're fresh. They provided fresh hard boiled, so why substitute the scrambled? It's a shortcut that Hampton Inn typically doesn't take. Every room typically has a refrigerator and microwave and have never had to pay more for a room with those two amenities. Why change what works, especially in the high tech area of North County? The fitness center is small with dated equipment. Upgrades are needed especially for this being in one of the healthiest and fittest communities in San Diego county. The business center is, well, a computer in the breakfast room ... might want to rethink the planning on that one. All in all, the Hampton Inn Del Mar has: an excellent location and nearby amenities. It has plateaued in a few areas, but after all, it's the attention to details that can make an average stay an excellent one.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep, great location, great free hot breakfast, free wi fi and parking!!”
Reviews.Author: m_khanna2
Reviews.Content: I am very picky with my hotels and read alot of reviews and do alot of research before booking one for my vacations. I have stayed at a Hampton before and was very happy with it so after reading the other positive reviews of this one and the fact that it was very inexpensive compared to other nearby hotels I went ahead and booked it. My husband and I enjoyed our stay immensly...we had a much better stay than our family who were staying at Hilton at Torrey Pines in La Jolla. Hot breakfast changed everyday giving us variety, belgium waffles were yummy, dining area was spacious with computer/printer station and two tvs. The lobby was roomy and nicely decorated for Christmas. Free wi fi and parking was a huge plus and they had extra parking underground which was helpful but the spots were tight due to large pillars. Despite 3 high school basketball teams staying the same week as us we had a great peaceful week at this hotel. The rooms and beds were very nice and hotel was nearby restaurants and other stores and right off of highway 5 and 20 minutes from San Diego airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Dirty_Sanchez_69
Reviews.Content: Good value for this hotel. We are paying under $100 US per night. It is clean and staff if very friendly. Only draw backs, poor gym facility, heat pool outdoor that is right in front of main entrance (no indoor pool) and small business centre. It only has 1 printer to be shared by entire hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel. Room hardware needs an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: LiangShanBo
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot (about to reclaim my Hilton Diamond status) and frequently stay in Hampton Inns. This one needs some upgrades though. While the public areas are nice, the rooms are on the small side considering this is a suburban area. The hardware also seems to need some updating. For example, faucet control was a little lose in the sink. Whenever I turned on the water was afraid I'd pull it out of the sink. Closets are behind a mirror and very small. Rooms don't have fridge or microwave (unless you get upgraded, which I had to specifically ask for even though I'm currently a Gold HHonors member after being placed in a regular room). Location is in Del Mar near Oracle and all the law firms. Malls are within driving distance. Reception has a helpful map listing restaurants and shops in the area. Ok Mexican restaurant right next door. Hotel is right off of I5 so very easy to get too but can be loud with all the traffic if you're facing the road. I always bring ear plugs with me so not an issue for me. There are several hotels nearby including Marriot and a Hilton Doubletree. I'll probably try the Doubletree next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but geared more to business than leisure travellers”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugged
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night, from 12-13 September 2010. The facilities were comfortable, functional and no frills. Everything in my room was clean and in good condition, and the bed was very comfortable. My only grouse about the room is the absence of a valuables safe. The location, at the intersection of two freeways, is probably ideal if you're on business in San Diego or the surrounding area (20 minutes' drive to downtown SD and within easy reach of surrounding towns, e.g. Carlsbad), but leisure travellers should probably bear in mind that it's not within walking distance of any tourist attractions. The dining room in the hotel only does breakfast: for dinner you'll need to go somewhere else. There is a strip mall with a number of restaurants about 15 minutes' walk away (the walk looked to me to be perfectly safe after dark), and there is also a restaurant and bar in the Marriott just across the street, though the restaurant is closed on Sundays. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room rate was OK for what it was: neither a ripoff nor a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: tfj5
Reviews.Content: We had drove in from LAX taking the Pacific Coast Highway. That was the most Beautiful Ride ever! If you got the time you gotta try it out. We were tired and really looking forward to relaxing in our rooms. The Front Desk people were very friendly and offered suggestions on where to eat or where to go for Happy Hour. The rooms were extremely clean and the beds were like sleeping on clouds! The rooms are spacious. The Breakfast offered on Saturday was awesome. They offered a selection of breads and muffins, a selection of cereals, a selection of fruits, and you could make your own waffles. As for what happened on Sunday I don't know.....but stay away from that turkey sausage! We went out to a great restaurant and bar suggested by the front desk in Del Mar called En Fuego's for dinner. The restaurant area looks over in to the Bar Area. A Great Place! We had a great stay at the Hampton Inn for a reasonable price. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “So Nice”
Reviews.Author: franDundalk_Ireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so nice, we arrived after a long drive from Tucson, Arizona and from the 1st moment we stepped into the hotel evrything was great. The front desk chap was Robert and he was excellent, he recommeded various restaurants in the area and we went to both his recommendations on 2 different nights, the best by a long shot was the Godfather (10 min walk from hotel) The breakfast (free) was served in the lobby which could get quiet busy but the food was great especially the sausage patties and the Orange juice. The pool was really clean and not to busy and for me as I was new to San Diego the staff have pre printed direction cards to downtown (15 min) and the various beaches such as La Jolla which we went to (10 min) The room was great with a very large bed which was sooo comfortable and large LCD TV. The bathroom was spotless with great shower and plenty of towels. Their was a game on the weekend we stayed there with lots of fans from the visiting team there but we where not disturbed by any noise during the night. For regular visitors to San Diego this hotel may seem a bit away from the city centre but because we had a car this did not cause us any problems and the area itself at 1st glance appeared to be industrial but it has lots of restaurants close by and some shopping areas also within close proximity. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone who is visting San Diego but you must have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Quiet”
Reviews.Author: lafjzum
Reviews.Content: It was full for ComicCon and we couldn't tell there was anyone else in the hotel - not doors slamming, no one stomping overhead. I attribute this to the construction of the building. The breakfast and workout room were the some of the best I have ever used. Rooms were roomey, new LARGE flat screen TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a Quick Getaway”
Reviews.Author: mgar2764
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a quick getaway for a small family on a budget. The rooms are clean and well appointed if a bit on the small side. I didn't care much for the 2 full-size beds in the standard double. I was under the impression that most hotels have queen-size as standard. Would have liked to have a mini-fridge in the room. The full breakfast is excellent and just what one needs to get started. Coffee was great in the morning but cold in the afternoon and evening. The parking is underneath and locked up at night which is a plus. Good restaurants located near the hotel and Torrey Pines beach is just a short drive away. All in all a great value, especially if you find a discounted rate as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet, but details not as nice as other Hampton Inns”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTraveler19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while visiting the Del Mar Fairgrounds. My wife liked it a lot, but I had some hesitations. The room did not have a mini-refrigerator which I thought all Hampton Inns had. If you are expecting a mini-frig, be sure and request it when making your reservations. The furniture and room colors were drab and boring, and could use upgrading or wall paper. The beds were very good. The flat screen t.v. was nice, but no HD channels, and in fact, only about a dozen channels. Could use Discovery and Fox Sports San Diego. The breakfast room downstairs is very big with a good breakfast, (although I would have liked some donuts or something sweet!). I thought the towels were very thin, and could use upgrading. There were no flyers/brochures of local attractions like all hotels have now days. I thought the Hampton Inn-Kearney Mesa was better. But, this hotel was VERY QUIET, considering all the people staying there during the fair! That was a major plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good for sleeping over.”
Reviews.Author: bearhug973
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, quiet and it does its job: a good room to sleep. The room has no fridge or a safe, which is surprising for this type of hotel. The breakfast was so so (horrible eggs, but nice DUI waffle).

Reviews.Title: “Safe and clean”
Reviews.Author: ADavis64
Reviews.Content: I stay at this Hampton about once a month and it is like my home away from home. Clean, quiet, and safe - I do not worry when I am here alone. The breakfast is adequate, although simple. I am always recognized as a return guest and have cookies and a bottle of water wating in my room for me. There are plenty of restaurants nearby as well as shopping. It is near the freeway and all the San Diego tourist attractions...

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveler57
Reviews.Content: The staff was quite nice but this is a not a great hotel for business travelers. It's really just about the rooms. There are only a few power outlets in the room in hard to access places. There is no wireless internet. There isn't actually a desk either - its just a square table pushed against the wall.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at a budget”
Reviews.Author: vicpink
Reviews.Content: Location: The location is about 20 minutes drive to downtown - gaslamp, zoo, seaworld, etc. About 5-10minutes drive to La Jolle beach and UC San Diego. There is a taco bell right next to the hotel. Despite it being near to the highway, it is very quiet. Parking: Free parking. You need to use your room card to enter the garage at the basement. Front desk: Nice and efficient. During our second night stay, some teenagers moved right next to our room. They were quite loud, so we complained to the front desk and was immediately given a new room. Rooms: Clean and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been 5 stars..... except....”
Reviews.Author: Cycleboy
Reviews.Content: This is pretty much a standard Hampton Inn, but I think it is a little older than most Hampton Inns. The staff was great. Houskeeping kept the place immaculate... but there were a few little things that if fixed would make it even better. 1st... I stayed in a handicapped accessible room (I use a wheelchair) and the bathroom had a roll-in shower and a very tiny fold down seat in the corner... maybe big enough for a two year old to sit on... but certainly not an adult. They cheerfully provided a tub bench, so that issue was solved. Because it was a handicapped room there was a sink installed that let you pull up under it in a wheelchair, but that resulted in having very little shelf/counter space to put toiletries,etc. Also the closet did not have a lowered rack, I couldn't reach high enough to use it. Also there was only one trash basket for the entire room, so you either had to put it in the bathroom or the bedroom. Also the closer on the door was way too heavy... it was almost impossible to open it. Little things.... but enough to make a difference between a great Hampton Inn and a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but VERY COMFORTABLE”
Reviews.Author: ELSWA
Reviews.Content: Location- close to Seaworld, Legoland and San diego Zoo. Very close to the beach, Vons grocery ( within the store are Subway, jamba juice and Panda Express), Spices thai cafe ( good thai food) , Souplantation, and some other restaurants. Room- basic, not too big nor too small but very clean. The hotel is along I5 freeway but the room was quiet. You have to pay extra for microwave and refrigerator. Beds- very, very comfortable!!! It was just what we needed after walking all day at the park. Pool- small. We did not use it because were out all day. Free breakfast (6 AM to 10 AM) - basic (egg, bread, bagel, coffee, danish, oatmeal, milk, juice, fruits, cereal, biscuit) but what's to complain if we only paid 89/night. extra- there's a computer and a printer in the breakfast room where you can print your boarding pass. Ample parking space.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value, Good Location, Clean Rooms, Could Use Newer Bathroom, Bigger Parking Spaces”
Reviews.Author: JEFF_AND_HAZEL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this room for just $99/night for a Friday and Saturday. The hotel is clean, and very conveniently located next to I-5. I was somewhat concerned that the hotel's close proximity to the freeway make for a noisy stay. However, the hotel must be well insulated because we had a very peaceful room. The beds are super comfortable. The included continental breakfast is on par with other hotels of this class. The hotel is located just a mile from the entrance to Del Mar beach and a short drive to La Jolla. Downtown is an easy (at least during the weekend) 15-20 minute drive away. The few downsides are.. the bathroom was clean but could use an update. There was absolutely no counter space in the bathroom. The TV is an older CRT model with just a handful of channels. Parking spaces in the parking garage are definitely not designed for larger vehicles. We had fun squeezing my wife's small car into the spots -- would have hated to try to park our Jeep in there.

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent, don't hesitate”
Reviews.Author: clumsy_phx
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for a month now... what a great hotel! The rooms are nothing special, but comfortable, if not smallish. Pool outside was small but perfect for the kids to splash around and heated (cool but not cold)! The breakfast buffet is fantastic, and it is INCLUDED!!!! It changes a little every day so fun and tasty. The hotel is in a great neighborhood, yet right next to the freeways which you won't hear. Del Mar is a great area, take a walk around! We asked to be in the wing that is AWAY from the AM/PM gas station behind, which btw is convenient if you need to do a beer run or whatever. There are several shopping/restaurant areas nearby, a couple nights we just picked up sandwiches. The staff are really fantastic and helpful, and most important they are LAID BACK. It's like they just want your day to go well and will give you no hassles about anything. We brought in a bottle of wine to the the main dining area one evening to enjoy a TV movie, no biggie. The housekeeping gals are great, be sure to tip them and give the breakfast gals a couple buck too. I cannot recommend this hotel enough: value, close to everything (just 10 minutes north of SD), great access to Del Mar beach/coastline/shopping, etc. We took their recommendation to go to Jakes in Del Mar, an upscale place on the water, so here is what you do: Arrive after 8pm when the parking meters on the street are free. Don't need a reservation, you can sit at their bar tables. Order kids meals for your kids (great kids menu) and then get yourself an appetizer or small entree. Be sure to order the house dessert, a delicious ice cream chocolate gudge mess, but huge enough for the whole table. We fed everyone, including beer and margarita for dad and mom for less than $100, at a really upscale but casual place on the ocean! Great memories from this trip... thanks Hampton Del Mar!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet, clean. We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: dianesocialworker
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant time here, but since it's San Diego, we didn't spend much time in our room. Please be advised that this is not a destination resort, so don't expect a giant pool, ocean views or room service. But if you want a newer, clean, super comfortable place to sleep and unwind, this is the hotel for you. The bedroom and bathroom are spacious, quiet, modern and clean. The king size bed was super comfortable, and there was a large flat screen, plasma tv. The breakfast buffet had many choices of muffins, cereal, eggs, toast, bagels, etc. There is a small pool and a decent fitness center. The open,centrally located lobby is next to a fast elevator (no steps). The staff was very helpful, pleasant, and accommodating. The hotel has a few turns to access to the freeway, but it really wasn't a problem. And the parking lot is user friendly, with extra parking underground. Everything about this hotel is convenient, clean, comfortable and user friendly. We'll be back. Two recommendations. Our room was facing the pool, but we heard no pool noise because no one was swimming during the colder weather. I would ask for a room situated further from the pool if you are planning on coming during the summer months. Also, I would ask for a room not facing the freeway. I don't know how much freeway noise there actually is. but better to be safe than sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: sunkizt
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel, it was very conveniently located - on some of the reviews some ppl complained about the noise (being so close to the highway) we slept with our windows open and it did not disturb us at all. This hotel was great value , the hot breakfast was a refreshing change from most other hotels continental breakfast , fruit and coffee all day long in the breakfast lounge area (someone on another review complained the coffee was not always warm, well...they DO have a microwave in the coffee area...) Going by another comment that the breakfast area was tiny - no it was not. There was ample space. They also have a sofa, coffee table and television set in the lounge area where you could enjoy your own bottle of champagne and snacks before heading out for the evening - or for winding down after the day out. My only slight 'complaint' is that the heated pool was not really heated, but more tepid. That in itself was not an issue either. The rooms were perfectly fine and comfortable. Great stay, great value for money. We were satisfied and would definitely stay there again Its literally 5 mins to the beach, and downtown Del mar. PS parking was ample, another reviewer mentioned that the parking was tight. You might have a problem finding a spot on returning from an evening out, however they DO have overflow gated parking with card control access at the lower level which goes directly to the elevators and up to your room, which is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a business trip”
Reviews.Author: JoeBruin1
Reviews.Content: I was worried that the Hampton Inn would have a lot of street noise. The hotel is located near a busy street and close to the freeway. Yet, I did not have any issues with traffic noises all night. The hotel has excellent insulation. There is a lack of restaurants in the area. There is a AM/PM next door, a Taco Bell and a sit down Mexican Restaurant-Tio Leo. You have to get in the car and drive a couple of miles to get to food. Check in was a breeze. The hotel staff were very friendly. The fitness center was adequate. The breakfast room was OK for someone in a hurry. Good selection of cereals and muffins, but nothing substantial (coffee was good). The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. The Hampton Inn was up to par with the Hilton brand standards. The bathroom was also clean. The room had free high speed internet. I did not use the WIFI since they had a CAT-5 cable in the room. The desk was spacious enough for work. Also, the coffee table and couch was a great addition in the room. All-in-all, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Standard Hotel - good for lower-budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: bonequinha_sf
Reviews.Content: This is your standard no-frills crashpad for the traveling, working stiff--clean, comfortable and basic. I've stayed twice and have had no complaints. It's easily accesible from the I-5, with a small outdoor parking lot and more parking underneath the hotel. (The outside parking can fill up pretty quickly.) There is currently no wi-fi in the rooms but the ensuite desk is neatly set up with an cord for the Internets. The King bed is large, pillowed and comfortable. You wield convenient control over the air conditioner, and when it's running you don't hear any noise from the freeway. Water pressure is fine, and the bathroom is larger than most. Free toiletries include shampoo, conditioner, bath and face soap, mouthwash. Breakfast is also nothing exciting, but free and plentiful -- there is usually some sort of hot offering available - meat such as bacon or sausage; french toast, pancakes; sometimes eggs. One can make toast, or select biscuits or bagels. There are pastries, yogurt, fruit, coffee and juice. Definitely not a bad, nonextravagant place for business travel in today's tough economic times.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hampton quality, but overlooked expressway or gas station”
Reviews.Author: hudeni
Reviews.Content: Greeted nicely when we arrived, but the maid service was lacking in the second day (not enough towels, didn't replace amenities). I'm sure could have been fixed with a phone call, but when in the middle of bathing kids, wasn't going to bother. Very nice continental breakfast, but wasn't crazy about the hot foods, but plenty of fruit, pastries and yogurt and well as other cold items(which seemed healthier anyway). Right off the expressway, so really no where to walk with little ones for a stroll, also, pool very small but seemed like guests enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad -- terrible water though”
Reviews.Author: hotelreviewer333
Reviews.Content: Stayed just for a night on a quick business trip to San Diego. I like staying in the Del Mar area, since it's usually cheaper than downtown or Hotel Circle, and traffic usually not an issue getting in or out of the city. Plus there's easy access to Hwy 101 and all the beach communities. This is a standard Hampton Inn which means good quality, nice comfortable room and bed, nice lobby, etc. The wifi doesn't reach to the upper floors, which i like to stay in. Not a problem, as they have a hard wired connection in the room that was fine. Very clean place, didn't hear neighboors. It's very close to both I-5 and CA 56 bypass, but I didn't hear the highways as long as I had the fan/ac unit on. My only thing to comment negatively on was the water in the room out of the bathroom sink tasted terrible -- really loaded with chemicals that made me nauseous, even from just brushing my teeth. Of all the reviews I've done here on T.A. around the country, I've never noted this before and it was so strong and noticeable I had to mention it.

Reviews.Title: “O.k. but not for Vacation”
Reviews.Author: sshuttle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for three nights during our recent vacation to San Diego. There was me, my hubby, and my son. The hotel was clean and the front desk staff were pretty helpful. The room was also very clean but small. I think this hotel is just fine for the business traveller, but it did not meet my needs for a family vacation. The free breakfast was poor with limited options. The attendants did keep everything stocked and clean however. The pool was small and right next to the parking lot so it did not have a "fun" feel at all. After arriving my son said, "This is NOT the pool!" Yes, I'm afraid it is. I originally chose this hotel thinking it would be a good jumping off point for day trips and it had free parking and free breakfast, but I wish I would have spent the extra money and stayed in town. I did not realize how difficult it would be to go back out in the evening with the traffic. Also, our last night there, a very loud sports group showed up and were yelling in the other room and running up and down the halls. When we called and complained, we could literrally hear their phone ring in the other room and the man saying, "They think that is loud, I'll show them what loud is!" I put my ear plugs in and called it a night! If you're looking for a family vacation hotel in San Diego, skip this area and stay where the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hampton in a quiet office park area”
Reviews.Author: BigTXN
Reviews.Content: Located in a quiet upscale office park with several other hotels, across street from a 12 story Marriott & Tio Leo Mexican Restaurant, 2 blocks to a Souplantation. good exercise rm - 1 treadmill & 4 other workout stations, computer available (often slow) in corner of breakfast rm, ethernet cable at table in room. Large upscale breakfast area - better than the usual bakery items that you find at these free breakfasts. No micro or refer in our room, but a micro is available in breakfast area. Quiet, only once in 4 nights did we hear TV or talking from the next room. In addition to the surface parking around the hotel, a parking garage was located under the hotel. Pricier than usual for our leisure trip stays, but it was comfortable, quiet and somewhat nicer than the average chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jstlve2trvl
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the Hampton Inn name - great for the price. Convenient access to the freeway & restaurants are nearby. A gas station right next door. Rooms were clean & enough room for a family of 4. Breakfast was avail w/staff checking to make sure everything was replenished & constantly cleaning. Definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Really Nice Experience!”
Reviews.Author: horn2tr
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a nice, clean, and comfortable place to stay while in La Jolla, Del Mar, or San Diego, this is it. I have stayed at much more expensive places nearby, and they weren't as nice. The room was comfortable and clean and the hotel seems relatively new. The bed was nice, I am one to have bad nights in hotels, but it was very comfortable. I was impressed with the breakfast in the morning, which is served in a large room, instead of a cramped breakfast area. Even the small workout room was ok, usually half the equipment doesn't even work right. Don't go there for the view, unless you like the look of an ARCO station! I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great For the Short Term”
Reviews.Author: Criticaltraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here overnight during the Christmas holidays. Very convenient to the freeways, but there's noise from the passing cars. Ask for a room away from the traffic. The breakfast buffet was more than adequate. All in all, a fine place for the short term. Rooms were basic but clean. Adequate free parking and a gas station next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: OzTraveller1961
Reviews.Content: My husband, two teenage children and I stayed in a suite in this hotel for 4 nights in September 2005. We really enjoyed our stay. The hotel has good access to I5 but is not noisy. The suites are very comfortable with two bathrooms, a king bed in the main bedroom, and a sofa sleeper (plus rollaway) in the other room plus microwave and fridge. Breakfast was very good (fruit salad, bagels, some cooked items, etc). Free internet access worked fine. The gym was small and gets a bit crowded in the morning. Staff were friendly and helpful. Only minor downside was the pool, which was on the small side and near the main entrance to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, and overall great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pal_plenti
Reviews.Content: Just got back from four nights/five days in sunny San Diego. After doing a ton of research on this website, I settled on the Hampton Inn/Del Mar. And I wasn't disappointed. It's darn near perfect if you're going to the races or anything at the fairgrounds. The rooms are not fancy by any means, but they're clean and have everything you need including free wi-fi. One nice feature of Hampton inns is that if you forget something like toothpaste, they'll bring some up to your room. Also the free breakfast is a terrific bonus with eggs, meat (something different each day, ham, sausage, etc.), cereal (hot and cold), pastries, juice, coffee. They also offered ready to go brown bag breakfasts, which included a bottle of water, a muffin, apple and cereal bar. All of which saved me time and money to enjoy the area. I chose Del Mar because i wanted to go to the horse races, but it also turned out to be centrally located for my other adventures, the zoo, animal park, Torrey Pines and the beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for bringing dogs”
Reviews.Author: AZhiker
Reviews.Content: This is a very dog friendly hotel. It was clean, offered a great breakfast, and the location was near Mission Beach and the ipayone center. We will return on the next trip. It offered a lot for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small room off the highway”
Reviews.Author: rl549
Reviews.Content: The positives = The bathrooms were nice, new, clean and had shampoo, condtioner etc.. The room was clean, Big TV with movies. Breakfast is included. Free parking. The whole hotel is sparkling, and well decorated. The less then positive = The hotel is literally right off the highway and our room was facing that direction. We didn't hear any noise but the view wasn't "relaxing". We were travelling with 3 kids. A single room is too small for a family of 5. We did it and we still can't figure out why. Make sure you get 2 rooms wth a family this size. The breakfast was good but not as good as the Marriott Residence Inn's breakfast. (Hampton Inn is lacking a waffle maker and homemade oatmeal cereal)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: CardsFan07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Del Mar for several nights in June 2005. Our standard double room was clean and up-to-date, very nice bathroom. Not the largest room in the world, but adequate. The daily free breakfast is excellent with lots of choices. The desk staff were cheery and very helpful, giving us a free map showing restaurants etc. close to the hotel. It is close to I-5 which makes it convenient for getting into town. Five-minute drive from Torrey Pines state beach & reserve. We are glad we chose this hotel, thank you TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights during a week spent in Southern California the week before Memorial Day weekend, and it was a great place to stay. About 10 minutes from La Jolla and 20 minutes from downtown San Diego, it's in a quiet area but close to the main highway running from SD to LA. Anyway, we paid extra for a two-room suite, and we were happy we did. The extra space was great, and it was only $150 a night. We found this Hampton Inn and the one at LAX airport to be the cleanest we've ever stayed in. It was spotless, and fresh smelling as well. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and everything worked, from the TVs to the refrigerator and microwave. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in the area.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: NJphotoGuy
Reviews.Content: First impressions mean a lot. The front desk staff at this hotel are great and go out of their way to do anything they can to provide you with a pleasant stay. Free covered parking and a great location just off I-5 was a big plus. The free high-speed internet and breakfast are nice. The rooms are large, comfortable and quiet. When I return to the San Diego area, I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: fredef
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hampton Inn Del Mar! The staff was excellent and granted every request within moments! The room, lobby and breakfast room are decorated with sturdy but modern & lovely furniture, very elegant! Rooms are spotlessly clean. The televisions in the rooms are good sized and two big screen TVs are in the breakfast room. The free continental breakfast is above and beyond just "continental." The parking is included and in a secure underground parking area. A great value for the money and the Del Mar area! We WILL be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I like to get down to San Diego on a regular basis so I prefer not to always shell out major bucks for my accomodations. This Hampton Inn near Del Mar really fits the bill. It's a lot nicer that you would expect to get for a $110 particluarly in this area of town. The lobby and rooms are fresh and the decor is excellent, plus the continental breakfast is included. Then add in the free covered parking and internet access and everything is totally copacetic. For the $100 I save each night by staying here instead of the Marriott next door I can eat at Ruth's Chris steakhouse down the street routinely and still have money to spend on the important stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Not your average off-ramp hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Luxly
Reviews.Content: I stay in Del Mar frequently for horse shows and was delighted to find this hotel after staying at a couple of others. This hotel is well-appointed, with strong attention to the customer. The breakfast has a wide variety of items and is served in a large, though home-like room. It is the perfect way to prepare for a long day of showing. As is to be expected of a highway-side hotel, there is road noise if the window is left open at night Otherwise, this hotel is anything but the standard off-ramp hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff here are amazing! The hotel is good value for money with free parking and complimentry breakfast. The best feature is the shuttle to the race track and fairgrounds!

HotelInfo.Name: Hampton Inn San Diego/Del Mar
HotelInfo.Address: 11920 Camino Real, San Diego, CA 92130
